instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't Install Firmware Update
threads.message: I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> on my bench with a really weird issue. It came in because the customer tried to update to Big Sur and the update failed and split his OS partition into 3. I backed up the data and wiped/tried to install Monterey from a freshly downloaded App Store copy on a USB drive and it fails after 5 mins saying "there was an error while loading the update". I tried installing Big Sur, and it gets further, but when it gets to the part where it boots into "recovery" to install a firmware update, the update immediately fails and the system restarts to the installer screen. I've tried connecting to WiFi and plugging in a Thunderbolt to ethernet cable, both to no avail. Have tried multiple downloads of the OS, multiple SSDs (internal and external). Current SSD is an original Apple 250GB. Board looks clean, no signs of liquid or corrosion. Does this sound like a wonky BIOS chip? What else could cause something like this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't Install Firmware Update
threads.message:
Many times BIOS gets corrupted when installing newer macOS version.
You should start reflashing the BIOS.

Did you try to install older macOS, not Big Sur?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't Install Firmware Update
threads.message:
Will give that a shot!

Sorry, forgot to mention - tried as far back as High Sierra. Got high Sierra to update to Mojave, but not any further.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't Install Firmware Update
threads.message: Hmm, tried a file from [URL='https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-fan-spin-butdont-comes-up-no-dong-no-display.61053/#post-74850']here on the forum[/URL] and one from BadCaps, both of them lead to the board cycling power. Couldn't find any other ones (they lead to dead links), do you know if there are any other files out there I can try? I have a backup of the original BIOS as well, but if the chip was potentially corrupted would this even be any good for anything?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't Install Firmware Update
threads.message:
That file is reported as working.
So you must have other problem than BIOS.

"Got high Sierra to update to Mojave, but not any further."
So you can install High Sierra from USB and upgrade to Mojave correctly?
Only fails to upgrade Big Sur?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't Install Firmware Update
threads.message:
That is correct - HS installed fine and upgraded to Mojave, but the Big Sur update fails.

Re-flashed the original BIOS just to make sure I didn't damage anything on the board, and we're back to square one with the board booting but not updating. Also definitely see the value in a Medusa now, would be very nice to not have to remove the chip from the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't Install Firmware Update
threads.message:
Probably not worth to install Big Sur on that machine.
Do you REALLY need that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't Install Firmware Update
threads.message: That's a very good point. I will have a chat with the customer and explain he probably won't get much of a benefit. Thanks for your thoughts on this one, appreciate it.
